pageContext.claim: “Well, as you know, for a period of time, we've been wanting to make a deal and so have the Taliban. Then we pulled back...And they also killed -- they killed a total of 12 people. They thought that was good negotiating power. I said, "No, that's bad negotiating power." That was not good what they did...And since then, we've hit them so hard, they've never been hit this hard. In the history of the war, they have not -- never been hit hard. And they want to make a deal.”
pageContext.analysis: The Taliban said, "The Americans walked away from the negotiating table, and now the ball is on their side – it is up to them to come back if they want to solve this…Our positions remain the same.” That's hardly the desperation that Trump describes.
